newsitem.title: USA: Ind. 543 MW Merom unit up after repairs - sources.
newsitem.headline: Ind. 543 MW Merom unit up after repairs - sources.

text.p: A 543 megawatt unit at the Merom coal-fired generating station resumed operation Friday following boiler tube repairs, sources familiar with the plant's operation said.
The Sullivan, Ind., unit was shut Monday when the boiler tube problem was discovered, those sources said.
The neighboring Merom unit 2, rated at 530 MW, was operating at full output, they said.
The Merom units are owned and operated by the Hoosier Energy Rural Electric Cooperative Inc.
